const uint  nTargets,

const uint  nLandmarks,
const std::vector< bool > &  robotsUsed,
const std::vector< Landmark > &  landmarksMap,
const std::vector< float >  alpha = std::vector<float>() 
)

ParticleFilter - constructor.

Parameters
nParticles- the number of particles to be in the particle filter
nTargets- the number of targets to consider
statesPerRobot- the state space dimension for each robot
nRobots- number of robots
alpha- vector with values to be used in the RNG for the model sampling

Definition at line 587 of file particles.cpp.

void pfuclt_ptcls::ParticleFilter::init ( const std::vector< double >  custom)

init - initialize the particle filter set with custom values

Parameters
custom- vector of doubles with the following form: <lvalue, rvalue, lvalue, rvalue, ...> which will be used as the limits of the uniform distribution. This vector should have a size equal to twice the number of dimensions

Definition at line 349 of file particles.h.

void pfuclt_ptcls::ParticleFilter::predict ( const uint  robotNumber,
const Odometry  odom 
)

predict - prediction step in the particle filter set with the received odometry

Parameters
robotNumber- the robot number [0,N]
odometry- a structure containing the latest odometry readings
Remarks
will not do anything if the particle filter has not been initialized
will not do anything if the current state of the robot robotNumber is not Predict
Warning
only for the omni dataset configuration
